articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel sent tanks into eastern Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip early on Sunday, after a night of heavy aerial and ground bombardments, killing 19 people and wounding dozens of others, health officials said.
articles.title: Israel pushes back into northern Gaza, ups military pressure on Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday defended a decision to pause a delivery to Israel of 3,500 bombs over concerns they could be used in the Gazan city of Rafah, saying Israel lacked a "credible plan" to protect some 1.4 million civilians sheltering there.
articles.title: Israel lacks 'credible plan' to safeguard Rafah civilians, says Blinken

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: Weeks after securing the boost of a $60 billion U.S. aid package, Ukraine is waging a tough new battle on its border, fending off a heavy Russian bombardment of northeastern Kharkiv region in an assault that will stretch Kyiv's manpower.
articles.title: Ukraine wages difficult border campaign even after securing more military aid

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: A former U.S. Marine pilot fighting extradition from Australia on U.S. charges of training Chinese military pilots to land on aircraft carriers, unknowingly worked with a Chinese hacker, his lawyer said.
articles.title: US Marine pilot arrested in Australia worked with Chinese hacker, lawyer says

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: "She stabbed him," Megan Black told Reuters in an exclusive interview. She said Gordon Black "had blood on his face."
articles.title: Exclusive: Before arrest in Russia, US soldier's relationship with Russian girlfriend turned bloody, wife says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from heavy rains in Brazil's Rio Grande do Sul state rose to 143, the local civil defense government body said on Sunday, up from 136 in the previous day, while another 131 people remain unaccounted for.
articles.title: Brazil floods kill 143, government announces emergency spending

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze vowed on Sunday to push ahead with a law on "foreign agents" that has sparked a political crisis, after opponents of the bill rallied in one of the largest protests seen since independence from the Soviet Union in 1991.
articles.title: Georgian PM vows to pass 'foreign agent' bill next week after thousands protest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The season's first major wildfire continued to burn across Western Canada as firefighters tamed the fast spreading blaze while authorities evacuated a town in British Columbia and advised residents of an oil hub in Alberta to prepare to leave.
articles.title: Spreading Western Canada wildfire prompts thousands to evacuate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dozens of students walked out of Duke University's commencement ceremony on Sunday as some chanted "free Palestine" to protest its guest speaker, comedian Jerry Seinfeld, who has supported Israel throughout the war in Gaza, according to a video posted on social media.
articles.title: Seinfeld speech at Duke commencement prompts walkout protesting his support for Israel

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: Experts say it's hard to maintain people power if most people are gone, but that energy might migrate to the streets.
articles.title: Gaza college campus rallies face next challenge: Summer break
